item.title: 5-day running average of Cases
item.description: The 5 day running average allows for a closer look at the current rate of infection and progress in the country. The red line shows how the 5 day running average of new cases per day has changed over the 14 days leading up to 2021-02-10. We have overlaid the trend over the two weeks previous to this, shown as the dashed blue line.

item.title: Cases by Age over last 2 Weeks
item.description: Below we show the breakdown by age of the infected over the last 2 weeks. The mean cases per million for the total population is shown as the yellow dashed line, as well as the mean excluding children (where incidence may be lower) as the green dashed line. Updated as of 2021-02-10.

item.title: Cases by County last 2 Weeks
item.description: Breaking down the data to the level of cases per county over the last 2 weeks allows us to observe the current infection hotspots nationwide in a manner which is obscured when viewing the cumulative cases to date per county. Updated as of 2021-02-08.
